title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://www.contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/.

title: Plotting healthy life expectancy and life expectancy by deprivation for English local authorities
text: one function fingertipsR package imports data Fingertips API; fingertips_data(). function following inputs: IndicatorID AreaCode DomainID ProfileID AreaTypeID ParentAreaTypeID least one IndicatorID, DomainID ProfileID must complete. fields relate described introduction. AreaTypeID also required, determines geography data imported. case want County Unitary Authority level. AreaCode needs completing extracting data particular area group areas . ParentAreaTypeID requires area type code AreaTypeID maps higher level geography. example, County Unitary Authorities map higher level geography called Government Office Regions. mappings can identified using area_types() function. ignored, ParentAreaTypeID chosen automatically. Therefore, inputs fingertips_data function need find ID codes : IndicatorID AreaTypeID ParentAreaTypeID need begin calling fingertipsR package:
code: library(fingertipsR)

title: Plotting healthy life expectancy and life expectancy by deprivation for English local authorities
text: two indicators interested exercise. Without consulting Fingertips website, know approximately called: Healthy life expectancy Life expectancy can use indicators() function return list indicators within Fingertips. can filter name field term life expectancy (note, IndicatorName field converted lower case following code chunk ensure matches overlooked result upper case letters). two indicators interested table : 90362 90366
code: inds <- indicators_unique() life_expectancy <- inds[grepl("life expectancy", tolower(inds$IndicatorName)),]

title: Plotting healthy life expectancy and life expectancy by deprivation for English local authorities
text: can work AreaTypeID codes need using function area_types(). ’ve decided want produce graph County Unitary Authority level. section start need codes AreaTypeID ParentAreaTypeID. plot chunk display_area_types table shows AreaTypeID County Unitary Authority level 202. third column, ParentAreaTypeID, shows IDs area types map . case County Unitary Authorities, : ParentAreaTypeID 6 default fingertips_data() function AreaTypeID 202 (value changes different AreaTypeIDs entered), can stick example. Use area_types() function understand areas map .
code: areaTypes <- area_types()

title: Plotting healthy life expectancy and life expectancy by deprivation for English local authorities
text: Finally, can use fingertips_data() function inputs determined previously. data frame returned fingertips_data() contains 26 variables. exercise, interested time period 2012-14: IndicatorID AreaCode ParentAreaName Sex Timeperiod Value data frame also contains data parent area, England, want filter remove .
code: indicators <- c(90362, 90366) data <- fingertips_data(IndicatorID = indicators,                         AreaTypeID = 202) ##  ##  ## |     | IndicatorID |      IndicatorName       | ParentCode | ## |:--------:|:-----------:|:------------------------:|:----------:| ## | **8023** |    90366    | Life expectancy at birth | E12000005  | ## | **8024** |    90366    | Life expectancy at birth | E12000006  | ## | **8025** |    90366    | Life expectancy at birth | E12000008  | ## | **8026** |    90366    | Life expectancy at birth | E12000005  | ## | **8027** |    90366    | Life expectancy at birth | E12000008  | ## | **8028** |    90366    | Life expectancy at birth | E12000005  | ##  ## Table: Table continues below ##  ##   ##  ## |     |       ParentName       | AreaCode  |    AreaName    | ## |:--------:|:----------------------:|:---------:|:--------------:| ## | **8023** |  West Midlands region  | E10000028 | Staffordshire  | ## | **8024** | East of England region | E10000029 |    Suffolk     | ## | **8025** |   South East region    | E10000030 |     Surrey     | ## | **8026** |  West Midlands region  | E10000031 |  Warwickshire  | ## | **8027** |   South East region    | E10000032 |  West Sussex   | ## | **8028** |  West Midlands region  | E10000034 | Worcestershire | ## | **8023** | County & UA (4/19-3/20) | Female | All ages |      NA      |    NA    | ## | **8024** | County & UA (4/19-3/20) | Female | All ages |      NA      |    NA    | ## | **8025** | County & UA (4/19-3/20) | Female | All ages |      NA      |    NA    | ## | **8026** | County & UA (4/19-3/20) | Female | All ages |      NA      |    NA    | ## | **8027** | County & UA (4/19-3/20) | Female | All ages |      NA      |    NA    | ## | **8028** | County & UA (4/19-3/20) | Female | All ages |      NA      |    NA    | ##  ## Table: Table continues below ##  ##   ##  ## |     | Timeperiod | Value | LowerCI95.0limit | UpperCI95.0limit | ## |:--------:|:----------:|:-----:|:----------------:|:----------------:| ## | **8023** | 2017 - 19  | 83.45 |      83.24       |      83.66       | ## | **8024** | 2017 - 19  | 84.25 |      84.02       |      84.47       | ## | **8025** | 2017 - 19  | 85.33 |      85.15       |      85.51       | ## | **8026** | 2017 - 19  | 83.85 |      83.58       |      84.11       | ## | **8027** | 2017 - 19  | 84.21 |        84        |      84.42       | ## | **8028** | 2017 - 19  | 83.8  |      83.54       |      84.06       | ##  ## Table: Table continues below ##  ##   ##  ## |     | LowerCI99.8limit | UpperCI99.8limit | Count | Denominator | Valuenote | ## |:--------:|:----------------:|:----------------:|:-----:|:-----------:|:---------:| ## | **8023** |        NA        |        NA        |  NA   |     NA      |    NA     | ## | **8024** |        NA        |        NA        |  NA   |     NA      |    NA     | ## | **8025** |        NA        |        NA        |  NA   |     NA      |    NA     | ## | **8026** |        NA        |        NA        |  NA   |     NA      |    NA     | ## | **8027** |        NA        |        NA        |  NA   |     NA      |    NA     | ## | **8028** |        NA        |        NA        |  NA   |     NA      |    NA     | ##  ## Table: Table continues below ##  ##   ##  ## |     |     RecentTrend      | ComparedtoEnglandvalueorpercentiles | ## |:--------:|:--------------------:|:-----------------------------------:| ## | **8023** | Cannot be calculated |               Similar               | ## | **8024** | Cannot be calculated |               Better                | ## | **8025** | Cannot be calculated |               Better                | ## | **8026** | Cannot be calculated |               Better                | ## | **8027** | Cannot be calculated |               Better                | ## | **8028** | Cannot be calculated |               Better                | ##  ## Table: Table continues below ##  ##   ##  ## |     | ComparedtoRegionvalueorpercentiles | TimeperiodSortable | Newdata | ## |:--------:|:----------------------------------:|:------------------:|:-------:| ## | **8023** |               Better               |      20170000      |   NA    | ## | **8024** |               Better               |      20170000      |   NA    | ## | **8025** |               Better               |      20170000      |   NA    | ## | **8026** |               Better               |      20170000      |   NA    | ## | **8027** |              Similar               |      20170000      |   NA    | ## | **8028** |               Better               |      20170000      |   NA    | ##  ## Table: Table continues below ##  ##   ##  ## |     | Comparedtogoal | ## |:--------:|:--------------:| ## | **8023** |       NA       | ## | **8024** |       NA       | ## | **8025** |       NA       | ## | **8026** |       NA       | ## | **8027** |       NA       | ## | **8028** |       NA       | cols <- c("IndicatorID", "AreaCode", "ParentName", "Sex", "Timeperiod", "Value")  area_type_name <- table(data$AreaType) # tally each group in the AreaType field  area_type_name <- area_type_name[area_type_name == max(area_type_name)] # pick the group with the highest frequency area_type_name <- names(area_type_name) # retrieve the name  data <- data[data$AreaType == area_type_name &                data$Timeperiod == "2012 - 14", cols]

title: Plotting healthy life expectancy and life expectancy by deprivation for English local authorities
text: Using ggplot2 possible plot outputs. plot chunk life-expectancy
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(data, aes(x = reorder(ParentName, Value, median), y = Value, col = factor(IndicatorID))) +         geom_boxplot(data = data[data$IndicatorID == 90366, ]) +         geom_boxplot(data = data[data$IndicatorID == 90362, ]) +         facet_wrap(~ Sex) +         scale_colour_manual(name = "Indicator",                             breaks = c("90366", "90362"),                             labels = c("Life expectancy", "Healthy life expectancy"),                             values = c("#128c4a", "#88c857")) +         labs(x = "Region",              y = "Age",              title = "Life expectancy and healthy life expectancy at birth \nfor Upper Tier Local Authorities within England regions (2012 - 2014)") +         theme_bw() +         theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45,                                          hjust = 1))

title: Plotting healthy life expectancy and life expectancy by deprivation for English local authorities
text: plot makes use fields within dataset default using fingertips_data() function. also deprivation_decile() function, provides indicator deprivation geographical area (see ?deprivation_decile). indicators available every geography. understand indicators mapped different gegoraphies, function indicator_areatypes(). understand comprises indicator, indicator_metadata() function, provides information definitions page Fingertips website. Finally, nearest_neighbours() function provides groups statistically similar area geographies available. geographies available , sources, documented within function documentation (?nearest_neighbours).

title: Fingertips Data for Public Health
text: R package interact Public Health England’s Fingertips data tool. Fingertips major public repository population public health indicators England. site presents information many ways improve accessibility wide range audiences ranging public health professionals researchers general public. information presented mixture data available public sources, available user access agreements organisations. source indicator presented available using indicator_metadata() function. package can used load data Fingertips API R use.

title: Fingertips Data for Public Health
text: Get latest released, stable version rOpenSci:
code: # Enable repository from ropensci options(repos = c(   ropensci = 'https://ropensci.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install fingertipsR in R install.packages('fingertipsR')

title: Fingertips Data for Public Health
text: can install latest development version github using remotes:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("rOpenSci/fingertipsR",                         build_vignettes = TRUE,                         dependencies = "suggests")

title: Fingertips Data for Public Health
text: example workflow downloading data indicator Healthy Life Expectancy Birth Public Health Outcomes Framework profile. profiles() function presents available profiles: table shows ProfileID Public Health Outcomes Framework 19. can used input indicators() function: Healthy Life Expectancy Birth IndicatorID equal 90362. Finally, data can extracted using fingertips_data() function using IndicatorID:
code: library(fingertipsR) profs <- profiles() profs <- profs[grepl("Public Health Outcomes Framework", profs$ProfileName),] head(profs) #> # A tibble: 6 x 4 #>   ProfileID ProfileName                        DomainID DomainName               #>       <int> <chr>                                 <int> <chr>                    #> 1        19 Public Health Outcomes Framework    1000049 A. Overarching indicato~ #> 2        19 Public Health Outcomes Framework    1000041 B. Wider determinants o~ #> 3        19 Public Health Outcomes Framework    1000042 C. Health improvement    #> 4        19 Public Health Outcomes Framework    1000043 D. Health protection     #> 5        19 Public Health Outcomes Framework    1000044 E. Healthcare and prema~ #> 6        19 Public Health Outcomes Framework 1938132983 Supporting information profid <- 19 inds <- indicators(ProfileID = profid) print(inds[grepl("Healthy", inds$IndicatorName), c("IndicatorID", "IndicatorName")]) #> # A tibble: 2 x 2 #>   IndicatorID IndicatorName                           #>         <int> <fct>                                   #> 1       90362 A01a - Healthy life expectancy at birth #> 2       93505 A01a - Healthy life expectancy at 65 indid <- 90362 df <- fingertips_data(IndicatorID = indid, AreaTypeID = 202) head(df) #>   IndicatorID                    IndicatorName ParentCode ParentName  AreaCode #> 1       90362 Healthy life expectancy at birth       <NA>       <NA> E92000001 #> 2       90362 Healthy life expectancy at birth       <NA>       <NA> E92000001 #> 3       90362 Healthy life expectancy at birth  E92000001    England E12000001 #> 4       90362 Healthy life expectancy at birth  E92000001    England E12000002 #> 5       90362 Healthy life expectancy at birth  E92000001    England E12000003 #> 6       90362 Healthy life expectancy at birth  E92000001    England E12000004 #>                          AreaName AreaType    Sex      Age CategoryType #> 1                         England  England   Male All ages         <NA> #> 2                         England  England Female All ages         <NA> #> 3               North East region   Region   Male All ages         <NA> #> 4               North West region   Region   Male All ages         <NA> #> 5 Yorkshire and the Humber region   Region   Male All ages         <NA> #> 6            East Midlands region   Region   Male All ages         <NA> #>   Category Timeperiod    Value LowerCI95.0limit UpperCI95.0limit #> 1     <NA>  2009 - 11 63.02647         62.87787         63.17508 #> 2     <NA>  2009 - 11 64.03794         63.88135         64.19453 #> 3     <NA>  2009 - 11 59.71114         59.19049         60.23179 #> 4     <NA>  2009 - 11 60.76212         60.39880         61.12544 #> 5     <NA>  2009 - 11 60.84033         60.38649         61.29417 #> 6     <NA>  2009 - 11 62.60207         62.07083         63.13332 #>   LowerCI99.8limit UpperCI99.8limit Count Denominator Valuenote RecentTrend #> 1               NA               NA    NA          NA      <NA>        <NA> #> 2               NA               NA    NA          NA      <NA>        <NA> #> 3               NA               NA    NA          NA      <NA>        <NA> #> 4               NA               NA    NA          NA      <NA>        <NA> #> 5               NA               NA    NA          NA      <NA>        <NA> #> 6               NA               NA    NA          NA      <NA>        <NA> #>   ComparedtoEnglandvalueorpercentiles ComparedtoRegionvalueorpercentiles #> 1                        Not compared                       Not compared #> 2                        Not compared                       Not compared #> 3                               Worse                       Not compared #> 4                               Worse                       Not compared #> 5                               Worse                       Not compared #> 6                             Similar                       Not compared #>   TimeperiodSortable Newdata Comparedtogoal Timeperiodrange #> 1           20090000    <NA>           <NA>              3y #> 2           20090000    <NA>           <NA>              3y #> 3           20090000    <NA>           <NA>              3y #> 4           20090000    <NA>           <NA>              3y #> 5           20090000    <NA>           <NA>              3y #> 6           20090000    <NA>           <NA>              3y

title: Area types — area_types

title: Area types — area_types
text: AreaTypeName Character vector, description area type; default NULL AreaTypeID Numeric vector, Fingertips ID area type; default NULL ProfileID Numeric vector, id profiles interest proxy_settings string; whether use Internet Explorer proxy settings "default" "none". Setting manually decrease runtime;  default determined automatically. path String; Fingertips API address. Function default correct address

title: Area types — area_types
text: data frame area type ids descriptions

title: Area types — area_types
code: if (FALSE) { # Returns a data frame with all levels of area and how they map to one another area_types()  # Returns a data frame of county and unitary authority mappings  area_types("counties")  # Returns a data frame of both counties, district # and unitary authorities and their respective mappings areas <- c("counties","district") area_types(areas)  # Uses AreaTypeID to filter area types area_types(AreaTypeID = 152)}

Setting manually decrease runtime;  default determined automatically. path String; Fingertips API address. Function default correct address

title: Fingertips data — fingertips_data
text: Outputs data frame data Fingertips. Note, function can take minutes run (depending internet connection speeds parameter selection).

title: Fingertips data — fingertips_data
code: fingertips_data(   IndicatorID = NULL,   AreaCode = NULL,   DomainID = NULL,   ProfileID = NULL,   AreaTypeID,   ParentAreaTypeID = NULL,   categorytype = FALSE,   rank = FALSE,   url_only = FALSE,   proxy_settings = fingertips_proxy_settings(),   path )

title: Fingertips data — fingertips_data
text: IndicatorID Numeric vector, id indicator interest AreaCode Character vector, ONS area code area interest DomainID Numeric vector, id domains interest ProfileID Numeric vector, id profiles interest. Indicator polarity can vary profiles therefore using one comparison fields recommended complete field well IndicatorID. IndicatorID populated, ProfileID can ignored must length IndicatorID (can contain NAs). AreaTypeID Numeric vector, Fingertips ID area type. argument accepts "", returns data available area types indicator(s), though can take long time run ParentAreaTypeID Numeric vector, comparator area type data extracted; NULL function use first record specified `AreaTypeID` area_types() function categorytype TRUE FALSE, determines whether final table includes categorytype data exists. Default FALSE rank TRUE FALSE, rank area compared areas combination indicator, sex, age, categorytype category along indicator's polarity. 1 lowest NAs bottom ties return average position. total count areas non-NA value returned also AreaValuesCount url_only TRUE FALSE, return url api call character vector proxy_settings string; whether use Internet Explorer proxy settings "default" "none". Setting manually decrease runtime;  default determined automatically. path String; Fingertips API address. Function default correct address

title: Fingertips data — fingertips_data
text: data frame data extracted Fingertips API

title: Fingertips data — fingertips_data
text: Note, polarity indicator automatically returned (eg,   whether low value good, bad neither). Use rank field   returned (though adds lot time query)

title: Fingertips data — fingertips_data
code: if (FALSE) { # Returns data for the two selected domains at county and unitary authority geography doms <- c(1000049,1938132983) fingdata <- fingertips_data(DomainID = doms, AreaTypeID = 202)  # Returns data at local authority district geography (AreaTypeID = 101) # for the indicator with the id 22401 fingdata <- fingertips_data(22401, AreaTypeID = 101)  # Returns same indicator with different comparisons due to indicator polarity # differences between profiles on the website # It is recommended to check the website to ensure consistency between your # data extract here and the polarity required fingdata <- fingertips_data(rep(90282,2),                             ProfileID = c(19,93),                             AreaTypeID = 202,                             AreaCode = "E06000008") fingdata <- fingdata[order(fingdata$TimeperiodSortable, fingdata$Sex),]  # Returns data for all available area types for an indicator fingdata <- fingertips_data(10101, AreaTypeID = "All")}

IndicatorID populated, ProfileID can ignored must length IndicatorID (can contain NAs). proxy_settings string; whether use Internet Explorer proxy settings "default" "none". Setting manually decrease runtime;  default determined automatically. path String; Fingertips API address. Function default correct address

title: Indicator metadata — indicator_metadata
text: metadata associated indicator/domain/profile identified

title: Indicator metadata — indicator_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # Returns metadata for indicator ID 90362 and 1107 indicatorIDs <- c(90362, 1107) indicator_metadata(indicatorIDs)  # Returns metadata for the indicators within the domain 1000101 indicator_metadata(DomainID = 1000101)  # Returns metadata for the indicators within the profile with the ID 129 indicator_metadata(ProfileID = 129)}

title: Indicator order number — indicator_order
text: Outputs tibble indicator ids sequence number provided domain area type. enables user order indicators ordered Fingertips website.

title: Indicator order number — indicator_order
text: DomainID Numeric vector, id domains interest AreaTypeID Numeric vector, Fingertips ID area type. argument accepts "", returns data available area types indicator(s), though can take long time run ParentAreaTypeID Numeric vector, comparator area type data extracted; NULL function use first record specified `AreaTypeID` area_types() function proxy_settings string; whether use Internet Explorer proxy settings "default" "none". Setting manually decrease runtime;  default determined automatically. path String; Fingertips API address. Function default correct address

text: data frame indicator ids sequence number

title: Indicator order number — indicator_order
code: if (FALSE) { indicator_order(DomainID = 1938133161, AreaTypeID = 102, ParentAreaTypeID = 6)}

title: Nearest neighbours — nearest_neighbours
text: Outputs character vector similar areas given area. Currently returns similar areas Clinical Commissioning Groups (old new) based NHS England's similar CCG explorer tool lower upper tier local authorities based CIPFA's Nearest Neighbours Model upper tier local authorities based Children's services statistical neighbour benchmarking tool

title: Nearest neighbours — nearest_neighbours
code: nearest_neighbours(   AreaCode,   AreaTypeID,   measure,   proxy_settings = fingertips_proxy_settings(),   path )

title: Nearest neighbours — nearest_neighbours
text: AreaCode Character vector, ONS area code area interest AreaTypeID AreaTypeID nearest neighbours (see nearest_neighbour_areatypeids) available IDs measure deprecated. Previously string; AreaTypeID = 102 measure must either "CIPFA" CIPFA local authority nearest neighbours "CSSN" Children's services statistical neighbours proxy_settings string; whether use Internet Explorer proxy settings "default" "none". Setting manually decrease runtime;  default determined automatically. path String; Fingertips API address. Function default correct address

title: Nearest neighbours — nearest_neighbours
text: character vector area codes

title: Nearest neighbours — nearest_neighbours
code: if (FALSE) { nearest_neighbours(AreaCode = "E38000002", AreaTypeID = 154)}
